decks.notes: This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus, while using efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending. The creatures in the deck, such as Boggart Trawler and Flickerwisp, work well with cards like Ephemerate to control the board. The key strategy is to apply pressure with aggressive creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Overlord of the Balemurk, while also gaining value from cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck aims to tempo out opponents while disrupting their game plan.

This deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach to continuously cast spells from the graveyard, activating Grinding Station to mill through the library and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage and graveyard interaction, while Urza's Saga generates tokens to protect key combo pieces. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card selection and Spell Pierce provides disruption. The deck aims to assemble the combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck revolves around using creatures with varying abilities to combo off and generate value through sacrifice, recursion, and tutoring. The toolbox aspect allows for flexibility in finding the right creature for the situation, while cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Dredger's Insight provide card advantage and enable the combo pieces to come together quickly. The inclusion of Boseiju, Who Endures and Malevolent Rumble help to protect key spells from countermagic, ensuring the combo can go off smoothly. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of synergistic creature abilities and powerful combo interactions.

This deck aims to use Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to quickly bring out powerful threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The control elements like Spell Snare and Kozilek's Return help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect our own creatures. Through the Breach can cheat out a big Eldrazi ahead of schedule, while cards like Stock Up and Nulldrifter help with card advantage. The deck's mana base includes Eldrazi Temple and various dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruption while utilizing powerful creatures like Ketramose, the New Dawn and Psychic Frog to establish board presence and pressure the opponent. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with spells like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending, while also providing card advantage through abilities like Unearth and Nihil Spellbomb. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's multicolor requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent and control the board. Cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls provide early pressure, while Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah allow for big, game-changing plays. The deck also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison for additional reach and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to establish a fast and threatening board presence while maintaining control over the game.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to slow down the opponent's game plan by countering their spells, removing their threats, and disrupting their hand. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and planeswalkers to control the board state and dictate the pace of the game. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion provides additional synergy and flexibility to the deck. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistency in casting spells and activating abilities. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition and card advantage.
